name: Crunchy Iceberg Dumpling
instructions: To prepare the filling, blanch all the vegetables together except the iceberg and keep it aside till itcools down.
Mix the rest of the ingredients with the blanched vegetables to form the filling.
Prepare the skin by using wheat starch and water in order to make a dough.
Cut and divide the dough into equals and use a roller to make wrapper.
Insert filling and fold into dumplings.
Serve hot.

name: Dan Dan Noodles
instructions: First, set the noodles to cook in boiling water, until tender but not soft. Then add the cabbage just enough to let it wilt a little - a few seconds. Remove and place aside. Meanwhile, thin the sesame paste with the sesame oil. Julienne the scallions and bean sprouts.
Place the condiments at the bottom of the bowl, then heap the nest of noodles and vegetables on top. Season, stir it all up and eat.

name: Garlic Soya Chicken
ingredients: 1 pound chicken thigh/breast  (cut crosswise into 1/2-inch-thin strips)
2 Tbsp peanut oil or vegetable oil, divided
1/2 red bell pepper (cut into thin strips)
2 tsp Chinese rice wine, or dry sherry (optional)
instructions: In a large bowl, toss chicken strips with toasted sesame oil and white pepper. Marinate for 10-15 minutes. Keep aside.
In a small bowl, stir together rice vinegar, soy sauce, dark soy sauce, Chinese rice wine (if using), brown sugar and cornstarch. Set aside.
Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of oil. When the oil is hot, add the chicken pieces, spreading it out as much as possible.
Sear for 1 minute without stirring until the edges are lightly browned, then stir to cook all sides until just cooked through , about 2-3 minutes more. Transfer chicken to a bowl and set aside.

Reheat the same wok, Put in another tablespoon of oil, add in garlic, ginger, and red chili flakes. Stir-fry over low heat for about 10-15 seconds, or until aromatic, taking care not to burn the garlic. Turn up the heat to high, add in snow peas and red onion, and stir-fry for another 30 seconds.
Add in red bell pepper, and cook for one minute - making sure to stir and toss the ingredients well.
When the vegetables are bright and almost crisp-tender, stir in the cooked chicken.
Take the prepared sauce, give it a stir, and quickly pour it into the wok, cooking until the sauce thickens.
9.  Add in one or two tablespoon of water if needed, toss well, and cook for a further 30 seconds or the mixture is hot and bubbly.
Turn heat off, and transfer to a serving plate.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Garlic Prawns
ingredients: 1 kg prawns (medium, deshelled, deveined with tails intact)
1 Tbsp garlic and green chilli blended paste
1/2 tsp chilli sauce (chilli garlic or sriracha)
instructions: Marinate prawns and leave aside for half an hour.
In a non stick pan. Put 2 tablespoon sesame oil, when hot add prawns.
Stir fry till prawn tails are curled and cooked(do not overcook).
Put in serving dish and serve with sauce.

name: Mapo Tofu with Spring Onion and Black Beans
ingredients: 300 gms diced silken tofu            1/2 tsp sichuan oil                                    2 Tbsp cooking oil                     1 tsp spicy black bean                           100 ml water                                          1/2 tsp dark soy                                       1/2 tsp red chili powder                   1/2 tsp sugar                   1 tsp spring onions, chopped                   2 Tbsp leeks sliced                       2 Tbsp water
instructions: Heat cooking oil and Sichuan oil in wok or pan, put chili bean paste, spicy black bean, sauté it.
Add ginger, garlic, chili powder and sauté for a while.
Add dark soy and water.
Put silken tofu, leeks, spring onion, and add sugar, let it boil for 2 minutes.
Meanwhile take a stainless steel bowl put potato starch and water to prepare thickening starch .
Adjust the thickening with potato starch and add it.
Serve hot

name: Warm Mushroom Salad
ingredients: 50 gm fresh cepe mushroom            50 gm fresh shitake mushroom         10 gm fresh button mushroom          20 gm fresh shimji mushroom          1 fried onion                              2 ml truffle oil                                Salt as per taste                                        1 tsp dark soy                                  1 tsp light soy                                 1/2 tsp spring onion                          10 ml oil
instructions: Soak the entire mushroom for 2 hours, and then slice all of them.
Add mushroom  in wok and toss them until it becomes dry.
Add oil in wok along with fresh dry mushroom, light soy, dark soy, and salt, toss it for a while.
At last add spring onion, and truffle oil.
Garnish with fried onion.

name: Wok Tossed Asparagus in Mild Garlic Sauce
ingredients: 200 gms asparagus             1 fried onion (medium)   1/2 tsp breakfast sugar                  10 ml potato starch      20 ml stock vegetarian
instructions: Boil the water, blanch asparagus, porcini  and keep aside.
Heat oil and add the chopped garlic.
Add vegetables and mushroom toss it and add stock.
Adjust seasoning along with potato starch to thicken sauce.
Garnish with fried onion and serve hot.

name: Hed Phad Medmamuang or Stir Fried Mushroom With Cashewnuts
instructions: Deseed and dice the capsicum. Dice the onions as well.
Remove the stem of the coral and black mushroom and soak them in water.
Pull out the stem and halve the button mushroom. Slice baby corn into diamond shape and blanch it.
Fry the cashew nuts and keep aside.Pour oil in the wok, add garlic and saute till light brown.Then, add all the vegetables and other ingredients in the wok, leaving the spring onions aside.
Garnish with diamond cut spring onions

name: 5 Spice Powder
instructions: Toast equal amounts of the spices in a dry pan over a low heat.
Then grind all the spices to a powder.
Store in an air-tight jar.

name: Vegetable Manchow Soup
instructions: In a pan, add some oil and stir fry the ginger, garlic, coriander leaves and green chilies for about two minutes.
Add all the vegetables, pepper, ajinomoto, salt and continue to stir-fry for two more minutes.
Add the Soya sauce, water and salt.
Let it boil, reduce the heat and add the cornflour mixed with water and stir constantly till it thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Garnish with spring onion stems.

name: Quick Noodles with Whatever
ingredients: 1 Tbsp vegetable oil                          1 cup sliced onions                        1 cup sliced peppers                                    1 cup carrot julienne                         1 cup spring onions sliced                             1 cup sliced mushrooms                                 1/2 iceberg/romaine lettuce

1 Tbsp ginger & garlic chilli paste                                   1 Tbsp soy sauce                                1 Tbsp schezwan sauce                     1/2 tsp turmeric powder                                 1 tsp sugar                            1 Tbsp chopped coriander                              2 Tbsp toasted crushed peanuts                               1 Tbsp lemon juice
instructions: Cook the noodles in boiling water according to the instructions depending upon the kind of noodles you are using. Drain, cool under running water.
Add a few drops of oil to the noodles to prevent them from sticking to each other.
In a wok, heat some oil to almost smoking point.
Then add the sliced onions, peppers, carrots, spring onions and mushrooms and the ginger garlic chilli paste.
Mix the soy, schezwan, turmeric and the sugar in a small bowl and mix well.
Add this mix to the vegetables. Then add the noodles and toss well. Season to taste.
Finish with chopped coriander and toasted crushed peanuts and lemon juice.

name: Cantonese Chicken Soup
ingredients: 5 pieces bok choy or any green vegetable.
instructions: De-skin the chicken and cut it into 10 -12 big pieces.
Now, slice the mushrooms into equal halves.
Layer the chicken pieces, bok choy and the mushrooms in a container.
Add the chicken stock to this.
Put this in an oven to cook for an hour and the soup is ready.

name: Stir Fried Tofu with Rice
ingredients: 2 tsp honey    Handful chopped coriander leaves
instructions: Drizzle refined oil in a preheated pan and add chopped mariner and stir well.
Then add ginger, garlic, shallots and salt & pepper.
Add red chilly paste, soya sauce and honey.
Add some coriander leaves and mix it all together.
For the fried rice:
Drizzle olive oil in a pre-heated pan and add carrots, spring onions, ginger and salt & pepper.
Then add fresh red chilly, lemon juice and soya sauce and stir all together.
Add some chopped coriander leaves.
Cook it away for 5-7 minutes.
Serve it on a platter.

name: Chicken Manchurian
ingredients: 2 Tbsp chopped celery or 1/4 tsp celery salt
instructions: Mix together the chicken, egg, flour, garlic and ginger paste, enough water so as to have a thick batter. Leave this for 5-10 minutes.
Heat the oil, keeping the heat high drop heaped teaspoonfuls of batter and fry to a golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper till required.
Heat 2 Tbsp of oil, and stir-fry the garlic and onion in it over high heat, till the onions look glossy. Add the capsicum and turn around a few times.
Add the sauce mixture, and simmer till the sauce thickens and becomes translucent.
Add the fried balls, turn around a few times and serve.

name: Chilli Fish
instructions: Cut the fish into finger pieces.
Make a batter with corn flour, maida, baking powder, soy sauce, celery, pepper powder, water and salt.
Dip the fish pieces in the batter and fry in oil till golden brown. Transfer fish into a serving plate.
For the sauce:
Heat oil in a pan.
Saute garlic, ginger and green chilly. Add soy sauce, chilly and tomato sauce to it.
Finally add corn flour mixed with water to it and stir well. Once it starts to boil, remove form fire.
At the time of serving, pour the sauce on top of fried fish pieces and mix well.
Garnish with chopped spring onions.

name: Chicken Cashew Nuts
instructions: Soak coral mushrooms till soft, then cut it into small pieces and remove the stem. Soak the black mushroom till soft, then remove the stem and cut it.
In a wok add oil. Put chopped garlic and stir till light brown. Add the onions, red capsicum, green capsicum and whole red chilli. Saute lightly.
Add chicken slices to it and all the sauces (fish sauce, oyster sauce, lemon juice) and sugar.
Add the spring onion, cashewnuts, tomatoes, riped mango, black pepper, black mushrooms and coral mushrooms. Adjust for salt.
Serve.

name: Tapioca Dumplings
instructions: For the filling:
In a mortar and pestle, grind the peppercorns, coriander, garlic and salt and form a paste.
In a pan, heat oil, fry the paste for about a minute.
Then on high heat, add the onions and the chicken, and stir-fry till it's all crumbly.
Add the peanuts, brown sugar. Give it a quick stir so that the sugar caramelizes.
Add the fish sauce and mix well.
Stir for a few minutes more and take off the heat.

For the wrapping:For the tapioca shell, mix the tapioca pearls and tapioca flour in boiling water, while stirring constantly. Knead the dough a bit but very gently, do not mash the pearls. It will be sticky and allow it to cool.
Dip your fingers in a bowl of cold water. Take a pinch of the tapioca dough, roll into a ball.
Then flatten it and fill it with the chicken filling.
Steam the dumplings.
Optional - you can drizzle a bit of garlic oil on top or black sesame seeds. Also instead of the tapioca covering you can use spinach leaves to wrap the filling.

name: Paneer in a Lemon Honey Sauce
ingredients: 1 cup paneer(cottage cheese), cut in cubes
A pinch of salt and pepper
A pinch of chopped parsley or coriander
instructions: Marinate the paneer with some salt and turmeric for 20 minutes.
In a wok (pan) heat the olive oil.
Once its hot add the garlic.
Saute.
Now add the honey and lemon juice.
Mix well.
Add a pinch of salt and pepper.
Once the sauce becomes nice ans thick add the paneer.
You can add more honey too if you like.
Sprinkle some lemon zest.
Add some chopped parsley or coriander if you like.
Mix well.
Garnish with some lemon juice and coriander.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Crunchy Iceberg Dumpling
instructions: To prepare the filling, blanch all the vegetables together except the iceberg and keep it aside till itcools down.

Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Oriental Dragon Fruit Salad
instructions: Break the lettuce in smaller pieces and put in bowl.
Peel the outer leaves of the fruit and chop it into small pieces.
Add some orange slices.
Then add the tomato slices. Season with salt and pepper.
For the dressing:
Mix all dressing ingredients and pour over salad.

name: Rice Noodles with Stir Fried Chicken
ingredients: 2 chicken breast, cut into thin strips
instructions: For the stir fry:
In a pan add oil, onions, capsicum, yellow bell peppers. Saute.
Add the Chinese cabbage, minced garlic and salt. Keep aside.
For the stir fried chicken:
In a bowl marinate the chicken and calamari with soya sauce, oyster sauce, lemon juice.
Stir fry it in a pan with some oil till done.
The main dish:
In the pan with the stir fried chicken add the rice noodles and stir fried vegetables.
Add soya sauce, lime juice, red chillies. Toss and add coriander leaves.
Garnish with toasted peanuts and spring onion greens.
Serve.

name: Garlic and Egg Fried Rice
instructions: In a pan add oil.
Add the egg. Cook for a minute.
Add the ginger, garlic and red chillies.
Add the steamed rice. Toss well.
Add salt, pepper and soya sauce.
Garnish with coriander leaves.
Serve with Asian BBQ chicken.

name: Duck Spring Roll
ingredients: 1/2 cup of sugar syrup with vinegar and lime juice
instructions: Boil the sugar syrup, vinegar and lemon juice togethar.
Pour this over the julienne carrots.
Now, cook the duck breast pieces in a pressure cooker with soy, ginger, onions and garlic.

Once the meat is cooked, lightly pan fry it with the same ingredients in sesame oil. Here you can throw in your favorites like maybe plum sauce or anything to make it more flavorful and then shred it to cut it firmly.
Now the rice paper wraps are already cooked so just soak them in water and then put it out on a damp cloth, nice and smooth.
Now top the wrap with some carrots, cucumber, bell peppers, the duck pieces, orange segments, spring onions and wrap up the roll.
Now mix all the ingredients to make the sauce. Top it up with some fresh coriander.

name: Prawns Wrapped in Noodles
ingredients: A pinch of sugar or 1/4 tsp
instructions: Marinate the prawns in lemon juice, red chilly, salt, pepper, coriander, onions and garlic.
Let it marinate for a couple of minutes.
In the meanwhile make the sauce.
Mix all the sauce ingredients.
Pierce the prawns with the satay sticks through the back of its tail.
Wrap these with the noodle strands and deep fry them.

name: Vegetable Fried Rice
ingredients: 1 bowl boiled rice (A day old rice make the best fried rice)
instructions: In a pan add 1 Tbsp oil, garlic and chilli. Saute.
Add carrots, baby corn, green beans and cabbage. Saute and add sesame oil. Add the rice.
Season with salt and pepper, soy sauce and wine. Cook for a minute.
Serve hot garnished with some chopped spring onion greens.

name: Stir Fried Lamb with Fried Rice
ingredients: 1/2 pound (1 cup approx) lamb leg meat, sliced
instructions: In a wok add oil, chopped garlic and chilli. Saute.
Add sliced lamb meat. Saute for 5-6 minutes.
Add red and yellow bell peppers. Saute.
Add oyster sauce, fish sauce, soy sauce, sugar, pepper and salt. Toss well.
Saute till lamb is cooked well. Add mint leaves. Saute for 1 minute.
Serve with fried rice.

name: Steamed Chinese Cabbage Parcels
ingredients: Black pepper and salt, to taste
1 big Chinese cabbage leaves removed and blanched in hot water (molding consistency)
Soy and vinegar with ginger slivers and green chillies
instructions: Mix the chicken mince with all ingredients (apart from the cabbage leaves). Marinate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Now take cabbage leaves and put a tablespoon of mince in the center of leaf and tie up with spring onion green stem. Chop the extra stem.
Steam well (20 minutes approx.) in a steamer. Serve in a bamboo basket with your favorite sauces.

name: Stir Fried Chilli Chicken
ingredients: 1 cup chicken, cut into bite sized uniform pieces
instructions: In a pan add oil. Add chopped garlic, chillies. Saute.
Add the chopped chicken and let it cook for a  minute. Coat the chicken with all the garlic and chillies. Add a little salt in that. Toss.
Once the chicken is almost cooked add chilli sauce, tomato puree, soy sauce and sugar. Cook till the sauce starts to reduce.
Add basil. Stir.
Serve.

name: Stir Fried Veggies in a Guillan Chilli Sauce
ingredients: 1 yellow bell pepper, cut into triangles
1/2 a zucchini, sliced into thin strips
30 gm green papaya, peeled and shaved
instructions: Heat a tablespoon of sesame oil in a wok and add all the chopped veggies to it.
Toss it well so that all the veggies cook equally.
Add the guillan chilli sauce to this and toss vigourously.
Add the vinegar, soy sauce and ginger and toss some more.
Transfer into a bowl or plate and garnish with spring onion.
You may serve with rice or eat as is.

name: Fragrant Noodles
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Drain and set aside in a bowl.
In the saucepan used to cook the spaghetti, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Add the spring onions and fry for a minute. Remove from the heat.
Stir in drained spaghetti, coriander, soy sauce and the pepper.
Serve immediately.

name: Broccoli with Onion and Garlic
ingredients: 2 skinless and boneless chicken breasts, chopped into 2 cm pieces (optional)
2 tsp peeled and crushed root ginger
instructions: Wash the broccoli thoroughly in cold salted water.
Cook it in boiling water for 2 minutes and drain.
Heat the vegetable oil in a wok and or large heavy-based pan.
Add the chicken, if using and fry for 5-6 minutes till it becomes opaque.
Tip in the onion and stir-fry for a minute. Tip in the garlic, chilli, and broccoli and saute over a medium heat for 5 minutes.
Stir in the ginger and peanuts. Add the soy sauce, black pepper, sugar and sesame oil (if using)
Mix well and serve the broccoli with noodles.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
instructions: Cut all vegetables, chicken and prawns in julienne style.
Take a wok and add the stock and add all vegetables along with chicken and cook.
Later add pepper, soy, salt, coriander, chili oil and vinegar.
Add corn flour for thickness and lastly the egg.

name: Dim Sums
instructions: For chicken and prawn dumplings:
Mince chicken and prawns and mix with sugar, salt, sesame oil and potato starch. Stuff the mixture in the wanton skin and steam.
Serve with Diamond & soya Sauce
For vegetable coriander dumplings:
Mix all ingredients except for wanton skin. Stuff the mixture in the wanton skin and steam.
Serve with diamond sauce.
For wanton skin:
Add cold water with potato and 50 gm of wheat starch, and mix with a pinch of salt.
Add hot water to the mixture and stir till it thickens. Add potato starch till it gets tight.
Make a roll and cut into small balls adding wheat starch over the ball.
Then roll the balls in a flat and round shape with a roller and add fillings.
For diamond sauce:
Soak 250 gm red chilies for 3 hours. Make into paste. Fry 100 gm garlic in oil.
When garlic gets brown, add chili paste, salt, sugar and soya bean powder.

name: chettinad masala
instructions: Heat oil in a pan.
Add onions, garlic and ginger paste. Fry till they are cooked and onions turn light brown.
Add chicken chunks. Add a pinch of sugar. Mix well.
Add soy sauce, green chilly sauce, salt, pepper and capsicum. Toss.
Let the chicken cook (10-15 minutes).
Serve hot.

name: Chilli Soya Nuggets
ingredients: 100 gm soya nuggets - soaked in water for 1/2 an hour & drained
instructions: Mix together the nuggets, 1 tsp salt and garlic paste.
Heat the oil, add the onions and stir-fry over high heat till a little brown at the edges.
Add the green chillies and stir a few times, add the remaindered salt, soya sauce, vinegar and the nuggets.
Stir-fry over high heat for a minute or so and serve garnished with some greens.

name: Manchurian Sauce
ingredients: 3 Tbsp corn flour-blended with 1/2 cup water
2 Tbsp chopped celery or 1/4 tsp celery salt
instructions: Mix all the ingredients, bring to a boil and simmer for 1/2 a minute.

name: Stir Fried Capsicum and Tofu
ingredients: 1 Tbsp soya sauce (adjust according to strength)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok, and stir-fry the onions, garlic, ginger and capsicum in it over high heat till onions and capsicums look wet.
Add the soy sauce, salt, vinegar, and the tofu.
Mix well, and serve garnished with some greens.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter

Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.

Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chicken Chopsuey
instructions: Mix together the vinegar, soya sauce, sugar, salt and corn flour and add enough water to make up to a cup.
Keep aside.
Heat the 2 tbsp oil and add the onions and garlic.
Saute till a little soft.
Add chicken and capsicum and stir-fry over high heat for a minute.
Add the sauce ingredients and bring to a boil again.
Deep fry the noodles over high heat till brown.
Drain.
Transfer noodles to a serving dish, pour the chicken mixture over and serve.

name: Gobhi Manchurian
ingredients: 3 Tbsp corn flour, blended with 1/2 cup water
2 Tbsp chopped celery or 1/4 tsp celery
instructions: Gather all your ingredients and make sure the cucumber florets are medium in size.
2. Mix all the ingredients - egg, flour, garlic, ginger paste and ajino moto to make a thick batter and then coat the cauliflower in it.
3. Let the coated cauliflower rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Heat the oil and fry the cauliflower till its golden brown and crisp. Make sure you fry the cauliflower on high heat.
5. Let the cauliflower rest on a tissue or any kind of paper which can soak the oil.
Heat the 2 tbsp oil, and stir-fry the garlic and onion over high heat. Let them cook till the onion seems translucent.
7. Add the capsicum and turn around a few times.
8. Slowly pour in the sauce and let it simmer. Over time, you'll see the mix losing water and becoming thicker with time. Keep it cooking till the sauce seems a bit translucent.
9. Add the cauliflower florets to the sauce.

10. Stir them around till they're completely doused in sauce.11. Serve hot.More recipes:Gobhi MasaledaarGobhi AlooChilli GobiVegetable ManchurianChicken ManchurianDry Vegetable Manchurian10 Best Cauliflower RecipesBharwan Gobhi

Gobhi MasaledaarGobhi AlooChilli GobiVegetable ManchurianChicken ManchurianDry Vegetable Manchurian10 Best Cauliflower RecipesBharwan Gobhi

name: Chicken Schezwan Style
ingredients:
Some greens for garnish (like finely chopped
 spring onion leaves)
instructions:
Mix chicken with
 the ground paste and vinegar.
Keep aside for at least 1/2 an hour.

Heat the oil in a wok and add the whole red peppers and saute over high 
heat till they darken a bit.

Add the onions and stir-fry over high heat 
till glossy.
Lift off the onions and peppers and keep aside.

Add the
 chicken and stir-fry over high heat, till opaque.

Lower the heat and 
cook till tender.     Add the onion mixture and bamboo shoots and mix.
Add the soya sauce, chilli sauce and salt and mix well over high heat.
Serve hot garnished with the greens.

name: Schezwan Sauce
ingredients: 2 Tbsp corn flour mixed in a cup of water
instructions: Grind together the onions, garlic and ginger.
Heat the oil in a wok add the whole red peppers and saute over high heat till they darken a bit.
Add the onions, garlic and ginger and stir-fry over high heat till glossy.
Add the corn flour mixture and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and add the chilli powder, vinegar, soya sauce, chilli sauce and salt and mix well.
Cook till well blended (1/2 minute) and use.

name: Mushrooms in Hot Garlic Sauce
ingredients: 3 Tbsp garlic, chopped fine and ground with 2-3 whole red peppers(paprika)
Spring onion leaves chopped fine for garnish
2 Tbsp corn flour - blended with water
instructions: Heat the oil in a wok and add the onions, stir over high heat till a little soft.
Add the garlic paste and red peppers and stir-fry till fat separates.  Add the mushrooms and stir-fry over high heat, till well mixed.
Add a cup of water, bring to a boil and add the sauce mixture and bring to a boil, stirring all the time.
Lower the heat and simmer for a minute or so and serve hot garnished with the greens.

name: Egg Fried Rice
ingredients: 1/4 tsp salt beat together the salt and eggs
instructions: Boil the rice, rinse under cold water till cool, and work 1 Tbsp oil into it. Leave it to drain.
Heat 1 Tbsp oil. Add the eggs and cook them, stir frying all the time so that they are cooked to a scramble. Keep aside till ready to use.
Heat the rest of the oil in a wok add the garlic and onion and stir-fry together over high heat for about 5 minutes or till the onion looks transparent, but is not soft.
Add the rice, Soya sauce, chilli sauce, vinegar and celery and mix together continuing to stir-fry over high heat.
Serve hot, garnished with the scrambled egg.

name: Lemon Glazed Vegetables
ingredients: 1/2 kg baby potatoes - boiled and halved
instructions: Keep potatoes and cauliflower hot, and saute the snow peas/ beans are in butter.
Remove and add beans to the vegetables.
Cook garlic, sugar, ginger and coriander in same pan with remaining   butter.
After 1 minute, stir in blended corn flour and stock. Thicken.
Sharpen with lemon juice.
Season well.
Serve immediately, garnished with lemon peel and almonds.

name: Vegetables in Plum Sauce
ingredients: 2 Tbsp cornflour/cornstarch blended with 1 cup water
instructions: Cut the peppers into halves, lengthwise and de-seed and cut off white veins.
Shred into thin strips.
Slice the baby corn into two, lengthwise.
Heat oil in a large pan and add the onions and garlic.
Stir till onions are wet (slightly soft), and add baby corn.
Add the peppers and continue to stir over high heat till they are mixed well.
Add the sauce mixture and bring to a boil.
Simmer till sauce looks smooth and serve hot.

name: Spicey Sauteed Asparagus
ingredients: 500 gm asparagus-cut into 2-3 pieces and blanched
Roasted white sesame seeds for garnish
instructions: Heat the clarified butter, add cumin, followed by ginger and saute lightly.
Add the asparagus.
Lower the flame, add the garam masala, coriander, salt, turmeric and chillies.
Stir a few times until well mixed.   Serve hot garnished with the sesame seeds.

name: Spring Rolls
ingredients: 3 Tbsp oil mix the water, oil and milk together
1 cups spring onions-including leaves, finely chopped
1 Tbsp flour, made into thin paste by adding water
instructions: Make the pancakes with the pancake ingredients.
Heat the 1 tbsp oil and stir-fry the garlic and onions over high heat till the onions are a little soft.
Add the rest of the filling ingredients and turn around a few times, still over a high heat.
Take a pancake and place a heaped tbsp of filling towards one edge.
Fold that edge over the filling, then the two sides thus formed over the fold, and roll over till the end, sealing that edge with the flour paste.
It is very important to seal the filling in, so that it does not spill out while frying.   Double fry the pancakes.

name: Chicken Manchow Soup
ingredients: 4 Tbsp cornflour mixed with 1 cup water
instructions: In a pan, stir fry the ginger, garlic, coriander leaves and green chilies for about 2 minutes.
Add all the vegetables, pepper and salt and continue to stir-fry for 2 more minutes.
Add the cooked chicken to the vegetable mixture and mix well.   Add the soy sauce, chicken stock and salt.
Let it boil, reduce the heat and add the cornflour mixed with water and stir constantly till it thickens slightly.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Garnish with spring onion stems.

name: Surprise Dumplings
ingredients: 200 gm cottage cheese or silken tofu
1 tsp molten butter, ghee or olive oil
1/2 Tbsp spinach - sauteed with garlic and cornflour
Breadcrumbs or poppy seeds or sesame seeds
instructions: Take cottage cheese and mix in wheat flour, semolina, couscous, egg, butter, lemon juice and salt.
Knead into a dough and refrigerate it for 1 hour.
Now take small portions of the dough and flatten them a little.
Fill with the desired fillings and fold in the shape of a dumpling.
Boil in simmering water till the dumplings rise to the surface.
Before serving roll them in breadcrumbs or poppy seeds or sesame.

name: Schezwan Chicken
ingredients: 2 tsp of corn flour - in 1 Tbsp stock/ water
instructions: Coat chicken in corn flour, salt and five-spice powder.   Brush off excess.
Stir-fry the chicken until lightly colored.   Remove from pan.
Pour off all but 3 Tbsp of oil.
Add chillies, garlic and ginger.
Cook for 30 seconds before adding onions and all the sauce ingredients.
Bring to a boil, return chicken to pan, heat through.
Serve with steamed rice.

name: Mulberry Glazed Chinese Cabbage, Bok Choy And Red Radish
instructions: Cut the Chinese cabbage, bok choy and red radish.
Immerse in water.
Heat oil in a wok, and add sliced onions along with the minced garlic, ginger and chili.
Add the cabbage, bok choy and red radish and stir-fry very quickly for 2 minutes.
Add a little salt. Give it good toss.
Add a few dashes of light soy, sweet chili and rice vinegar.
Add a tablespoon of the mulberry glaze to the stir fry.
For the Mulberry-Ginger Glaze:
In a saucepan heat up some brown sugar, mulberries, balsamic vinegar, soya sauce, green chilies, garlic and ginger.
Add a pinch of salt and some cracked black pepper.
Put it into a blender until it looks like a nice thick sauce.
In another bowl toss the radish shavings with the mulberry glaze and mix with the other stir fried vegetables.
Put in a bowl and serve.

name: Pumpkin and Morning Glory Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 bunch of morning glory leaves or 2 bunches of bok choy
A few drops of sesame oil
2 stalks of spring onion greens for garnish
instructions: Soak the leaves in water and rinse thoroughly.
Peel the pumpkin into thin long ribbons.
In a wok, heat the oil and stir fry the chilli, onions and garlic for a few seconds.
Then add the morning glory and pumpkin.
Season with salt, sesame oil, oyster sauce and malt vinegar.
Mix well and add fresh coriander.
Stir fry on a high flame for a minute.
Garnish with spring onion greens and serve hot.

name: Honeyed Prawns
ingredients: 2 tsp ginger peeled and chopped finely
For the Sauce:2 Tbsp soya sauce
instructions: First prepare the sauce. Mix the cornflour in water and add the soya sauce and honey. Keep aside.
Heat oil on moderate heat. Add ginger, spring onion and chillies.
30 seconds later, add the prawns.
Stir fry for about two minutes.
Pour in the sauce till it boils and it looks glossy.
Add salt and fresh black pepper.

name: Char Siu Paneer Crusted with Peepli Peppers
ingredients: 2 stalks of spring onions, roughly chopped
50 gms of broad beans, thinly sliced
instructions: Arrange the cottage cheese cubes on a tray and marinate them with 1 tsp of vegetable oil, char siu sauce, 1 tsp of soya sauce and crushed peepli peppers.
In a pan, heat up 1 tsp of vegetable oil and pan sear the marinated cottage cheese for 2-3 minutes.
Cook from both sides till the cottage cheese has a dark brown crust.
For the cherry oyster glaze:
In a pan, heat 1 1/2 tsp of vegetable oil.
To the hot oil, add 1 roughly chopped spring onion, grated ginger, pitted cherries, lime zest, lime juice, vegetarian oyster sauce and salt.
Mix them well and let it cook for about a minute till all the ingredients begin to change color.
Next, add 1/2 a cup of vegetable stock; stir well and let the sauce simmer for 3-5 minutes.
Once the sauce has thickened and reduced, pour it into a mixie and blend it.
Transfer the blended sauces into the pan and let it reduce for about 5 minutes.
For the sauteed broad beans:
In another pan, heat 1 tsp of olive oil and saute the sliced broad beans and one chopped spring onion.
Then add a pinch of salt, red chilli paste and 1 tsp of soya sauce and stir well.
Next, add a touch of vegetable stock and mix well.
For the plating:
Make a bed of sauteed broad beans and arrange the pan seared cottage cheese cubes over it.
Pour the cherry oyster glaze and garnish with crushed peepli peppers, cherries, chopped spring onions and cilantro leaves.

name: Swiss Chard Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 tsp red chilli paste with black beans and garlic
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan and sauté minced ginger, baby onions and minced garlic.
Then add swiss chard into the pan and toss well.
Add the red chili paste, season with salt and stir fry together.
Serve hot.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

name: Chole Bhature
ingredients: 1 tsp whole pepper corns (sabut kali mirch)
1 green chili (chopped)                      1 tea bag                                                1 Tbsp butter
1/2 tsp yeast, dissolved for 10 minutes in luke warm water
instructions: For chole:
In a pan add oil, bay leaf, cinnamon, cumin seeds, cloves, whole pepper corns, green and black cardamom.
After it gets brown add chopped onions and saute it.
After sauteing add chopped ginger and garlic.
Then add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, asafoetida, salt and fry well.
For de glazing the pan add little water.
Now add the chole (soaked overnight and pressure cooked) to the masala.
After stirring well add tomatoes, little sugar and salt to the chole (chickpeas)
Now add ajwain, chopped green chilies and water for the base.
To get the color in the chole, add a tea bag to the masala.
Simmer the chole gently for an hour and cover it.
Add lime juice and a dollop of butter to it.
Garnish the chole with coriander and butter.
Serve the chole hot with bhaturas.
For the bhaturas:
Knead the whole wheat flour, maida and salt together with adequate amount of water.
Sprinkle the yeast on top. Leave it for 2-3 hours for the yeast to work.
Divide it into equal portions. Roll out in an oval or round shape.
Deep fry till golden brown, like a puri.
Serve.

name: Quick Chicken Curry
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté the onion paste, garlic & ginger paste till golden brown.
Add tomato puree. When the tomato puree dries up, add coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, red chilli powder, turmeric powder and salt. Let the spices cook.
Add chicken pieces into the masala. Stir well and cook till they are golden brown.
Add 1/2 cup of water and stir. Cover with a lid and let it simmer till the chicken is cooked.
Garnish with chopped coriander and serve.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: For marinating the chicken
In a mixing bowl, mix red chilli powder, ginger garlic paste, salt and curd.
Add the raw chicken pieces to the marinade and mix well. Keep it in the refrigerator overnight or minimum 6 hours.
Roast the marinated chicken in a tandoor or an oven for about 10-12 minutes until it is three-fourth done.
For the chicken gravy
Heat half the quantity of white butter in pan.
Pour in the tomato puree, and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add cumin seeds, sugar, red chilli powder and salt. Mix well.
Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Jasmine Tea Rice
instructions: Infuse some jasmine tea in hot water for a few minutes along with some orange and ginger pieces.
Give it a boil.
Strain the liquid in another pan.
Put two three pieces of spring onion stalks in this liquid. Keep the heat low.
Add a pinch of salt.
Now add the soaked rice to it.
Allow it to cook for about 7-11 minutes.
Now in another pan heat a tablespoon of vegetable oil.
Add to that the garlic, spring onions and mushrooms. Saute.
Add a pinch of salt.
Add some soy sauce, balsamic vinegar and teriyaki sauce.
Mix with veggies and stir fry. Add the garlic chives.
Saute and keep aside.
Now once the rice is cooked plate it, topped with the smoked veggies.
Garnish with some chives.

name: Peppered Cottage Cheese and Cluster Beans
ingredients: 30 gm chopped spring onions with greens
instructions: Cut the cottage cheese into cubes.
Sprinkle black salt, 5 spice powder, cracked black pepper, cornstarch and white wine vinegar over the paneer cubes.
Fry in hot oil and set aside.
In a wok, heat the oil and add the spring onions, asparagus and beans along with the ginger, garlic, chillies and toss for 3 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, black bean sauce and a dash of sherry vinegar, brown sugar and the chopped herbs.
Add the cottage cheese, season to taste with salt and pepper.
Garnish with sprigs of coriander and chives.

name: Wok Tossed Veggies in Honey and Black Bean Glaze
ingredients: 1 1/2 tsp black bean and garlic paste
instructions: Slice 4 sweet gourd/jungli karela/Kantolla, break one healthy bok choy, broccoli (only the florets) and 1 medium sized chopped Chinese cabbage.
In a wok put a tablespoon of oil, add all the chopped veggies to it.
Season with salt.
Add water chestnuts and shitake mushrooms.
Add soya sauce and black bean and garlic paste, juice of ½ lime, add honey and cracked black pepper.
Mix well in the wok for about 4-5 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Shitake Fried Rice with Water Chestnuts
instructions: Slice the shitake mushrooms, green chillies & water chestnuts.
Heat a wok with vegetable oil.
Put onions, celery and leeks.
Add grated ginger, mushrooms and sliced water chestnuts.
Put in the cooked rice, spring onions, few drops soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, garlic and sesame oil.
Stir fry nicely and serve in a bowl.

name: Eggless Noodles with Red Chillies and Tamarind
ingredients: 1 handful cashew nuts washed and cut
1 Tbsp red chilli paste/ sambal oelek
instructions: In a pot or pan of boiling water, add the noodles for 2 to 3 minutes.
Drain out the cooked noodles from the water.
Add oil so that the noodles don't get stick to each other.
Cut tofu into cubes, marinate with soya sauce.
Dust the tofu with a tablespoon of corn starch, fry quickly in a little oil until golden brown.
Drain the excess oil and set aside.
Add some cashew nuts to the wok and also fry until light brown.

In the same wok add cabbage, carrots, spring onions, ginger, garlic, Malabar cucumber, bok choy, soy sauce, brown sugar tamarind pulp and finally add in the noodles and give it a good mix and then finally toss.
Add roughly chopped coriander leaves.
Put it in a bowl garnish with the fried tofu, cashew nuts and the bean sprouts.

name: Arbi Soup with Oriental Spices
instructions: Heat oil in a pan; sweat the diced onions, celery, leeks, ginger and the spring onion for 5 minutes.
Add the arbi to the pan and sweat for 3-4 minutes.
Deglaze with a little rice wine vinegar and light soy sauce.
Add the lemon grass and lime leaves, followed by the vegetable stock.
Cook on simmer till the vegetables are soft.
Add the thinly sliced mushrooms, bok choy, cabbage leaves, Chinese cabbage leaves and carrot to the soup and simmer.
Add the lemon juice, jaggery and salt and pepper.
Garnish with mint and coriander leaves.

name: Mixed Vegetables in Black Bean Sauce
ingredients: 1 1/2 Tbsp garlic and black bean sauce(bottled)
instructions: Slice up all the vegetables.
Put ginger, garlic, chilli and lemon grass with some water in a mixer and blend into a fine paste.
In a wok, put in the oil and heat till smoking hot.
Stir fry the paste and add all the vegetables, give it a good mix.
Season with salt, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, black bean sauce and give it a nice toss for 3-4 minutes.

name: Chicken with Chestnuts
instructions: Soak mushrooms in boiling water for 30 minutes. Drain and discard stems.
Heat oil. Stir-fry chicken until browned. Remove from pan.
Stir-fry capsicum, ginger and garlic for two minutes.
Return chicken to pan with remaining ingredients, except lettuce and coriander.
Heat through and season well.
Serve on a bed of lettuce, garnished with coriander.

name: Asian BBQ Chicken
ingredients: Oil, to pan sear the chicken
instructions: In a bowl, mix all the marinade ingredients. Mix the chicken with the marinade and keep aside for 15 minutes.
Pan sear the chicken from both sides.  Serve with garlic and egg fried rice.

name: Crispy Wispy Shrimp
ingredients: For the batter:  1 cup corn starch
For the marinade:   1 Tbsp soy sauce
instructions: Make a lumpy batter by mixing all the ingredients together. Marinate the shrimp for 45 minutes.   Dip in flour, then batter and deep fry in hot oil .
For the sauce, just mix the ingredients together.

name: Stir Fried Asian Greens
ingredients: Spinach leaves, a large handful, shredded
1 tsp rice wine vinegar (You can use lemon juice or white vinegar)
instructions: In a hot wok add olive oil, onions, ginger and garlic. Saute.
Add spinach, bok choy, cabbage, capsicum, chillies and green mango. Saute on high heat.
Add the vinegar, salt, soy and pepper.
Toss and serve with rawas fillets with ginger lemon sauce.

name: Date Pancakes
ingredients: 1/2 cup dates - ground and mixed with little sesame oil
1 Tbsp sugar syrup - flavoured with star anise
instructions: In a bowl mix together baking powder, refined flour, sugar and egg yolk.
Dilute this mixture with water to form a thick batter and keep aside for about half an hour.
Make small patties with the ground dates.
Heat a non-stick pan and drop in a two spoonfuls of the batter to form mini pancakes.
Now place a date patty on one pancake and quickly cover it with the second pancake.
Cook till golden brown and serve.

name: Green Chilli Sauce
ingredients: 1 kg green chillies - washed and chopped
1 tsp sodium benzoate - dissolved in 2 Tbsp of boiled water
instructions: Dissolve the salt in the vinegar and marinate the green chillies in it for 1 hour at least.
Heat the mixture and bring to a boil.
Cook over high heat till it thickens a bit.
Take it off the heat and mix in the sodium benzoate mixture.
Store in an airtight clean bottle.

name: Mushroom Fried Rice
instructions: Boil the rice with 1 tsp salt and 1 Tbsp oil, till bite-like.
Drain and rinse under cold water.
Leave in the colander and work 1 Tbsp oil into it.
Heat the rest of the oil and saute the mushrooms and celery over high heat, till they look glossy.
Add the soya sauce, vinegar and chilli sauce, mix well and add the rice.
Stir till rice and vegetables are well mixed and serve.

name: Honey Glazed Potatoes
instructions: Cover the potatoes with salted water.
Cook until tender, drain.  In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Stir in water, honey, salt and pepper.
Add potatoes and stirring occasionally, cook potatoes (trying to keep in one layer) 10 to 12 minutes or until brown.

name: Hot and Sour Soup
ingredients: 1/4 cup corn flour dissolved in 1/2 cup water or the stock
instructions: Bring to stock to a boil and add the rest of the ingredients.
Simmer 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the carrots and cabbage, bring to a boil and serve.
Note: If you want Chicken Hot and Sour, use chicken stock and add cooked, cubed chicken when you add the carrots and cabbage.

name: Vegetable Chowmein
instructions: Bring water and salt to boil. Add noodles and cook 'bite like' -- just blanch if fresh and cook longer if dry.
Drain immediately and cool under running water till noodles are thoroughly cooled.
Work 1 tbsp of the oil into the noodles and leave in the colander till required.
Heat the rest of the oil and stir- fry garlic mixture and onions over high heat till onions are glossy.
Add the vegetables and stir to mix well.   Add the soya sauce, salt, celery, vinegar and chilli sauce. Mix well and add the noodles and stir- fry till well mixed. Do all this over high heat.
Serve hot.

name: Vegetable Dim Sum
ingredients: For the Dough: 2 cups refined flour
For the Filling:1 cup finely minced cabbage (or mixed vegetables)
instructions: Mix the maida and salt and knead to a stiff dough, with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic. Saute till a little soft and add the vegetables.   Turn around over high heat till slightly cooked.
Take it off the heat and mix in the salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Wet the edge, place some filling in the center and bring edges together to cover the filling. Press to seal -- it will form a half moon shape. Steam for about 10 minutes and serve.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.

instructions: For marinating the chicken

Add the prepared chicken, white butter, fresh cream, sliced green chillies and crushed fenugreek leaves.  Saute for 3-4 minutes and let the chicken cook.
Cook till chicken is done. Serve hot with rice or naan.

name: Chinese Stir-Fried Vegetables
instructions: Fry the vegetables on high heat for 5 minutes.
Add soya sauce and chilli paste.
Add the roasted sesame seeds and toss it around for a while.
Then add the strips of the egg and serve.

name: Crunchy Vegetable Stir-Fry
instructions: Remove crusts from bread and slice into strips. Bake at 160 degrees C till crisp.
Top and tail snow peas, pare and slice asparagus stems. Pare carrots into thin ribbons.
Combine all vegetables.    Mix topping ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside.
Stir-fry spring onions, broccoli and cauliflower for 1 minute. Add carrots.
Add 2 Tbsp water and stir till vegetables are tender. Stir in snow peas and seasoning.
Turn into serving dish, stir in bread strips and parsley topping.    Serve immediately.

name: Okra with Baby Corn
instructions: Fry onions in hot oil. Add the onion seeds, fennel seeds and mustard   seeds. Season with salt.   Cook for 5 minutes.
Add shredded garlic and crushed red chillies.     Fry till onions brown and stir in the okra.
Add baby corn, green chillies, and coriander and lemon juice.
Add tomatoes just before serving.

name: Capsicum Stir Fry
ingredients: For the capsicum sauce:250 gm capsicum - deseeded and finely chopped
Red, green and yellow capsicum - deseeded and shredded
instructions: For the sauce:
Heat oil for capsicum sauce and saute capsicum and chilli sauce for 15-20 minutes.
Add jaggery and lemon juice to pan.
Puree sauce and season well.
For the veggies:
Heat both oils together and add capsicum, beans and garlic. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Add onions and nuts.
Continue cooking for a further minute and stir in honey and soya sauce. Cook for a further minute.
Place on top of the sauce before serving.

name: Dry Vegetable Manchurian
ingredients: 500 gm mixed vegetables - chopped fine or grated
instructions: Mix together the vegetables, egg, flour, salt, garlic and ginger paste, and enough water so as to have a thickish batter. Leave for 5-10 minutes.
Heat the oil and keeping the heat high drop heaped teaspoonfuls of batter and fry to a golden brown. Drain on absorbent paper till required.
Serve with a white sauce or an Italian tomato sauce.

name: Stuffed Mushroom Caps
ingredients: 8-10 small cubes of firm tofu (50 gm)
instructions: Wash and remove the stems from mushrooms.
Make a mixture of miso, water, vinegar, sesame oil, garlic and ginger. Set aside.
Put the mushrooms and the water together and stir over medium heat until the water has evaporated and the mushrooms are beginning to darken.
Pour the miso mixture over and cook about 30 seconds longer and remove from heat.
Pour the mushrooms and their marinade into a dish and allow to sit for half an hour to absorb the flavors.
Separately toss the peppers in garlic and then add the parsley and tofu. Cook for about 30 seconds.
Season and add the excess liquid left from marinating.
Stuff the mixture into the mushroom caps and serve hot.

name: Stir Fried Mushrooms
ingredients: 2 bamboo shoots steamed and cut lengthwise
instructions: Stuff the bamboo shoot with the pumpkin. Do the same with the winter melon. Now, cut the stuffed pieces horizontally into 4 -5 portions
To make the rice noodle basket:
Press the rice noodle mesh between two steel bowls. Flash fry with the containers to make rice noodle bowls.
Heat water in a wok on a high flame. Put the Chinese cabbage, salt, corn starch, sugar and some oil on top. Fry for 10 seconds. Drain the water and the Chinese cabbage is ready
Now add mushrooms to hot oil. Add salt, corn starch, sugar, oyster sauce and soya sauce. Stir fry on high flame for 10- 15 seconds
Garnish with prawn seeds (if desired) and serve in the rice noodle basket, decorated with the stuffed bamboo shoot and Chinese cabbage.

name: Tofu with Vegetables in Black Bean Sauce
instructions: In a thick bottomed pan heat the oil.  When the oil is hot add the red chilli, let it colour nicely then add the garlic, ginger, saute for 10 seconds
Add the diced onions saute for 15 seconds and then add the diced tofu.  Stir fry for a minute and then add the black bean sauce.
Dissolve the corn flour in cool water and add to the pan.  Remove serve garnished with chopped onion greens.

name: Baby Corn Manchurian
instructions: Mix together the egg, flour, garlic and ginger paste, ajino moto and enough water so as to have a thickish batter. Coat the baby corn with this batter and leave for 5-10 minutes.
Heat the oil and keeping the heat high drop baby corns, one at a time and fry to a golden brown.
Drain on absorbent paper till required.
Heat the 2 Tbsp oil, and stir-fry the garlic and onion in it over high heat, till the onions look glossy.
Add the capsicum and turn around a few times.
Add the sauce mixture, and simmer till the sauce thickens and becomes translucent.
Add the fried corn, turn around a few times and serve.

name: Honey Cauliflower
ingredients: 1/2 kg cauliflower - cut into small florets
1 Tbsp white sesame seeds (safed til)-slightly roasted
For the Sauce:1/4 cup melted butter
instructions: Mix together the cornflour, salt, pepper, egg and enough water to make a batter of pouring consistency.
Heat oil. Dip cauliflower into batter and fry till cooked through but crisp (like a pakora).
Remove from the oil and transfer on to absorbent paper.
Mix honey, butter and lemon juice and just before serving mix the gobi into it and heat over high heat to heat through.
Serve hot, garnished with the sesame seeds.

name: Kapa Maki
ingredients: 1 sheet of yaki-nori or roasted seaweed
1/4 cup short grain Japanese rice-cooked with vinegar, sugar and kombu seaweed
2 tsp gari shoga or marinated ginger
instructions: Place the yaki-nori on a bamboo-rolling mat and spread the rice evenly over it leaving 3/4 inch of sheet on the far side uncovered.
Keep the cucumber in the center. Now, lift the top of the bamboo mat and roll it over. Put some rice on the edges of the yakinori to seal it.
Repeat the rolling procedure once again, exerting gentle pressures. Slice the prepared roll in equal portions and serve with ginger, wasabi and soya sauce.

name: Vegetables Salt and Pepper
ingredients: 1 cup vegetables (cabbage, cauliflower, capsicum, carrot, etc.) - cut thinly
instructions: Wipe the vegetables dry with a cloth and dust with flour, shake off excess and keep aside.
Mix the cornflour, salt, pepper, garlic paste and add enough water to make into a pouring consistency - when you drop it from a spoon it should pour in a continuous line.
Heat the oil, dip vegetables into the batter and place into the hot oil.
Turn, fry for a few seconds and remove from oil and keep aside on an absorbent paper.
Just before serving, fry once again over high heat, drain on absorbent paper and serve.

name: Vegetable Fried Rice
instructions: Boil the rice with 1 tsp salt and 1 Tbsp oil, till 'bite-like'. Drain and rinse under cold water.
Leave in the colander and work 1 Tbsp oil into it.
Heat the rest of the oil and saute the garlic and onions, till onions are a light brown.
Add the beans and cook over low heat, till almost done.
Add the carrots, peas and celery and cook till all vegetables are bite-like.
Add the Soya sauce, vinegar and chilli sauce, mix well and add the rice.
Stir till rice and vegetables are well mixed and serve.

name: Soya Dumplings in Tomato Sauce
ingredients: For Tomato Sauce:1 cup tomato puree
instructions: Mix the soya, bread, salt, garlic paste, vinegar and pepper.
Blend well together and form into round balls.
Heat the oil and deep fry to a golden.
Heat 2 Tbsp oil in a kadahi, add the ajwain and then the puree, salt, sugar and chilli powder.
Saute till well blended, add the fried dumplings and stir to mix well.
Serve the Soya Dumplings hot, garnished with the coriander and with noodles if you like.

name: Vegetable Chopsuey
ingredients: 200 gm noodles - boiled and drained well
instructions: Mix together the vinegar, soya sauce, sugar, salt and cornflour and add enough water to make up to a cup. Keep aside.
Heat the 2 Tbsp oil and add the onions and garlic.
Saute till a little soft. Add the carrots, cabbage and capsicum and stir-fry over high heat for a minute.
Add the water mixture and cook, stirring continuously. Keep aside.
Deep fry the noodles over high heat till brown. Drain.
Transfer noodles to a serving dish, pour the vegetables over and serve.

name: Baby Corn Soup
ingredients: 1 cup baby corn-slit into two, lengthwise
4 Tbsp cornflour mixed with 1 cup water
instructions: In a pan, stir fry the ginger, garlic, coriander leaves and green chilies for about 2 minutes.
Add the corn and all the vegetables (except cabbage), pepper, and salt and stir-fry 2-3 times.
Add the soya sauce, water and salt. Let it boil, reduce the heat and add the cornflour mixed with water and stir constantly till it thickens slightly, then add the cabbage.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

name: Lemon and Coriander Soup
ingredients: 2 Tbsp lemon juice or to taste
2 tsp chilli sauce or to taste
instructions: Bring stock to a boil.
Add onions, lemon juice, salt, half of the coriander leaves and black pepper.
Bring to a boil and simmer for a minute.
Place the rest of the dhania leaves in the soup bowls, pour soup over and serve.

For Stock: Use vegetable stock. You can add onions, carrots, garlic, 
mushrooms, tomatoes, celery and peppercorns. You need to boil all these 
in water for about 15-20 minutes. Pour the stock through a sieve and it for the soup. You could also use a vegetable stock cube available in leading food stores and super markets.

name: Chicken Cantonese Soup
ingredients: 1 breast of chicken - de-boned and cubed
instructions: Put stock in a sauce pan, place over high heat and bring to a boil.
Add chicken pieces and simmer for about 10 minutes.
Add the cornflour mixture and cook till the chicken is tender.
Add the onions, carrots, celery, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce and vinegar and simmer for 2-3 minutes and serve.

name: Chocolate Cake in a Pressure Cooker
instructions: In a mixing bowl, sift the flour, cocoa powder and baking powder.
Add in the butter, sugar, salt, water and vanilla, and beat the ingredients using a whisk.
Add the eggs and beat the batter until smooth.
Transfer into the baking tin.
Heat the pressure cooker, covered with the lid but without the pressure, for 3-4 minutes on high heat, then place the cake tin in the empty cooker (do not add water in the cooker).
Close the lid (without the pressure), lower the flame and let it cook until done (about 30 minutes).

name: Honey Chilli Potatoes
instructions: For the potatoes:
In a bowl, add cornflour or maida, salt and red chilli powder.
Add the sliced potatoes and mix well until the potatoes are coated.
Heat oil in a wok and deep fry the potatoes until golden. Keep aside.
For the Base:
In a wok, add oil, garlic paste and spring onions. Saute on high heat for 1 minute.
Add capsicum, honey, salt, soya sauce, chilli sauce. Saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add the deep-fried potatoes and sesame seeds. Mix well and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Momos
instructions: Mix the maida, salt and baking powder and knead to a stiff dough with water.
Heat oil and add the onion and garlic.
Saute over high heat and add the carrot and cabbage. Turn around over high heat till glossy.
Take it off the heat and mix in the Soya sauce, salt, vinegar and black pepper.
Roll the dough thin (translucent) and cut into 4"-5" rounds.
Take a round, wet edges and place some filling in the center.
Bring edges together to cover the filling. Twist to seal and fill the rest in the same way.
Steam for about 10 minutes and serve with soya sauce and chilli sauce.
